Title.evidence: Background: Acute Kidney Injury (AKI) can lead to detrimental outcomes, including prolonged hospital stays, progression to chronic kidney disease, and even mortality.

Participants.evidence: patients who underwent abdominal surgery at Seoul National University Hospital

Objective.evidence: We aimed to explore the association between preoperative platelet count and postoperative AKI in patients undergoing abdominal surgery.

Number_Analysed.evidence: A total of 7,131 patients who underwent abdominal surgery in the INSPIRE database were included in our study.

Result_Outcome.evidence: A significant negative association was observed between preoperative platelet counts and postoperative AKI risk across all models ( P for trend < 0.001 in unadjusted and partially adjusted models, 0.002 in fully adjusted model).
